bibl.title: English translation [from Spanish] of letter from Ignacio Alvare to Philip Showalter Hench, December 8, 1941

div1.p: This is an abridged translation of Alvare's letter, in which he praises Hench for his attempt to give Finlay credit for his yellow fever work. He describes his visit with former interns from the Hospital Militar and their recollection of Camp Lazear. He explains the origin of the photograph that he recently sent Hench, identifying the photographer as Felipe Ortolazabal.

div1.head: English translation [from Spanish] of letter from Ignacio Alvare to Philip Showalter Hench, December 8, 1941 See Spanish original.
div1.opener:
COMMONWEALTH OF VIRGINIA
STATE DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH
LEXINGTON-ROCKBRIDGE HEALTH DEPARTMENT
LEXINGTON, VIRGINIA
December 9th, 1941
Dr. Philip S. Hench
Rochester, Minn.
Dear Doctor Hench:
div1.p:
Accept my sincere thanks and deep appreciation of your kindness
in sending me the copies of your Reed article. So many problems
have come up recently in my work that I am uncertain whether I have,
previously, sent you an acknowledgement. I read the article with
deep interest and shall greatly prize its possession.

Since your brother is at the University of Virginia I shall
look forward to your suggested visit. If you see General Truby
and Dr. Pinto please give them my cordial regards.

Wyeth Bros. did send me a copy of the painting and I would
be happy to have a few more copies of your article.
